School.title: School
School.description: Represents a school within the system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the School entity.

status.description: Status of the school, e.g., 'active' or 'inactive'.

deletedAt.description: Timestamp when the school was soft-deleted.

User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user in the system.

id.description: Unique identifier for the User entity.

role.description: Role of the user (Admin, Teacher, Parent, Student).

Grade.title: Grade
Grade.description: Represents a grade level within a school.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Grade entity.

name.description: Name of the grade (e.g., 1st Grade, 2nd Grade).

Section.title: Section
Section.description: Represents a section within a grade.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Section entity.

name.description: Name of the section (e.g., A, B, C).

gradeName.description: Denormalized name of the referenced Grade.

Subject.title: Subject
Subject.description: Represents a subject taught in the school.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Subject entity.

name.description: Name of the subject (e.g., Math, Science).

Course.title: Course
Course.description: Represents a course offered, linking a subject to a specific section and teacher.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Course entity.

subjectName.description: Denormalized name of the referenced Subject.

sectionName.description: Denormalized name of the referenced Section.

teacherName.description: Denormalized name of the referenced Teacher.

schedule.description: Schedule of the course (e.g., 'Monday 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM').

StudentCourse.title: StudentCourse
StudentCourse.description: Links students to courses they are enrolled in.

id.description: Unique identifier for the StudentCourse entity.

studentId.description: Reference to User (Student). (Relationship: User N:N Course)

courseId.description: Reference to Course. (Relationship: Course N:N User)

Attendance.title: Attendance
Attendance.description: Records student attendance for a specific course.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Attendance entity.

isPresent.description: Indicates if the student was present (true) or absent (false).

GradeRecord.title: GradeRecord
GradeRecord.description: Stores individual grades for students in a course.

id.description: Unique identifier for the GradeRecord entity.

grade.description: The grade received by the student for a specific assessment.

assessmentType.description: Type of assessment (e.g., Exam, Homework, Project).

ChatMessage.title: ChatMessage
ChatMessage.description: Represents a chat message between users.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ChatMessage entity.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the message was sent.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents a notification sent to a user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Notification entity.

timestamp.description: Timestamp of when the notification was sent.

isRead.description: Indicates whether the notification has been read by the user.

TuitionPayment.title: TuitionPayment
TuitionPayment.description: Represents a tuition payment made by a parent.

id.description: Unique identifier for the TuitionPayment entity.

paymentDate.description: Date when the payment was made.

paymentMethod.description: Method of payment (e.g., PayPal, Credit Card).

Assignment.title: Assignment
Assignment.description: Represents an assignment given to students in a course.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Assignment entity.

SubmittedAssignment.title: SubmittedAssignment
SubmittedAssignment.description: Represents a submitted assignment by a student.

id.description: Unique identifier for the SubmittedAssignment entity.

submissionDate.description: Date when the assignment was submitted.

id.description: Unique identifier for the OnlineExam entity.

ExamQuestion.title: ExamQuestion
ExamQuestion.description: Represents a question within an online exam.

id.description: Unique identifier for the ExamQuestion entity.

answerOptions.description: Available answer options for the question.

StudentExamAttempt.title: StudentExamAttempt
StudentExamAttempt.description: Represents a student's attempt at an online exam.

id.description: Unique identifier for the StudentExamAttempt entity.

submissionTime.description: Time when the student submitted the exam.

score.description: The score the student obtained on the exam.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to support EduLink's core features, focusing on scalability, security, and ease of management. The primary strategy is to leverage path-based ownership for user-specific data and membership maps for collaborative data.  Authorization Independence is achieved by denormalizing relevant authorization data (like schoolId and roles) into subcollections when needed, avoiding costly `get()` calls in security rules.

**Explanation of Structure and Authorization Independence:**

*   **/schools/{schoolId}**: Stores school-specific information. Top-level collection allows for easy listing of schools by admins. No authorization dependencies here, as admin access is controlled via the `/roles_admin/{uid}` collection.
*   **/users/{userId}**: Stores user profiles. Path-based ownership ensures that only the user (or an admin) can access their own profile data.
*   **/schools/{schoolId}/grades/{gradeId}**, **/schools/{schoolId}/sections/{sectionId}**, **/schools/{schoolId}/subjects/{subjectId}**:  These subcollections of schools maintain information regarding grades, sections and subjects. The `schoolId` is present in each document, enabling straightforward security rules to restrict access based on the school. Admins can manage all data within a school, while teachers might be limited to specific grades or sections (roles managed in the /users/{userId} document).
*   **/schools/{schoolId}/courses/{courseId}**: Courses are subcollections of schools. Authorization is managed by checking the `teacherId` against the current user's `uid` and the user's role. School admins can also manage courses.
*   **/users/{userId}/studentCourses/{studentCourseId}**:  This path structure provides easy access to a student's courses. Security rules can easily verify that the requesting user is the owner of the `studentCourseId`.
*   **/users/{studentId}/tuitionPayments/{tuitionPaymentId}**:  This enables easy access to a student's payments. Security rules will ensure a user can only access their own payment info or an admin can access all payments for reporting. The `studentId` provides ownership context.
*   **/schools/{schoolId}/assignments/{assignmentId}**: Assignments are associated with Courses, however we place assignments at the school level so that teachers or admins can manage assignments across all courses for a given school. Security rules will ensure that only teachers assigned to the course, or admins for the school can create/modify assignments.
*   **/users/{studentId}/submittedAssignments/{submittedAssignmentId}**: Each submission links to an assignment and a student.  Security rules ensure only the student can create the submission and teachers for that assignment can access it. 
*   **/schools/{schoolId}/onlineExams/{onlineExamId}**: Exams are organized at the school level for easy management. Access is controlled by verifying the user's role and course association.
*   **/schools/{schoolId}/onlineExams/{onlineExamId}/examQuestions/{examQuestionId}**: Exam questions are stored as a subcollection of exams.
*   **/users/{userId}/examAttempts/{examAttemptId}**:  The student exam attempts are stored under the user, simplifying access to view attempts by student.
*   **/chatMessages/{chatMessageId}**:  Since the relationships between sender and receiver are 1:1 and there is no parent documents the chatMessages are placed in the root of the database, the database is optimized for frequent write. 
*   **/users/{userId}/notifications/{notificationId}**: The notifications are stored under the user, simplifying access to view notifications by user.
*   **/roles_admin/{userId}**:  This collection stores the IDs of admin users. The existence of a document for a user in this collection grants admin privileges. This is existence-based DBAC.

**QAPs (Rules are not Filters):**

The design addresses QAPs by using structural segregation and appropriate data denormalization:

*   **List Operations for Schools (Admin):** The flat `/schools` collection, combined with the `/roles_admin/{uid}` collection, allows for listing all schools, restricted to admins via simple existence checks.
*   **List Operations for User-Specific Data:** The path-based ownership (e.g., `/users/{userId}/studentCourses/{studentCourseId}`) enables efficient and secure listing of resources belonging to a specific user.
*   **Authorization Independence:** By denormalizing `schoolId` and roles where required, the structure avoids the need for server-side filtering or complex `get()` calls in security rules, ensuring list operations are secure and efficient.

This structure provides a secure, scalable, and maintainable foundation for EduLink, aligning with best practices for Firestore development.
